I have removed the DOT parsing since in ES 2.4.x a startup flag allows to let dots be used in field names again
Also in this branch is the beginnings of the integration of the BulkProcessor API to speed up some bulk operations (such as profile updates)
Close and replaced by PR #20
Thanks for providing all the comments on the methods.

- Missing one placeholder for the CFG file
- rename mailChimpConnector.list.merge-fields to mailChimpConnector.list.merge-fields.mapping
- rename mailChimpConnector.list.merge-fields.activation to mailChimpConnector.list.merge-fields.activate
- rename listMergeField to listMergeFieldMapping
- rename mappingMergeFieldsActivation to isListMergeFieldsActivated
- Do not forget to rename associate getter/setter
- The function updateMergerPropertiesForList should be renamed to updateMCProfileProperties, the code to create the properties in the list should be extracted from this function to a private function named something like createPropertiesForList, add a javadoc for this specific function to explain why we need to do that.
- You should also create a private function named updateMCProfileProperties to be use by the addToMCList and therefore change the signature of the public function which should not take the actual last parameter.
- In the addToMCList ensure you add the profile or update the status before trying to update the profile with the new properties.
- getAllMergeFieldofOneMCList ??? should probably be renamed to getMCListProperties
- newMergeFields to mergeFields
- tabMergerField to mergeFieldInfo

I have chosen to add a second migration script to 1.3.0 version. This could cause problems to people who already executed a migration to 1.3.0, but in theory nobody should execute migration script of unreleased version in important (production-like) environments. If this is a problem, a simple solution would be to allow choosing which migration scripts to execute.

This is my first pull request, comments welcome.
If the threshold have a default value equal to 1, there is a small issue, that if we have a matching condition with the score value equal to 0

What is the point of having a condition with a score 0 ? And even if you had one, we would expect that had no influence on the result, and the content should not match. In your case it will match, which is rather inconsistent.
In this case, i prefer to keep the default value of the threshold to 0, and change the operator of comparison in the condition of IF statement to `>` instead of `>=`.
Mmm for me the threshold is the value at which the effects starts to happen, so _including_ the value itself, but it's more a matter of semantics :-)
I agree.
The new solution with default threshold = 1 looks good to me. I will run some manual tests.
After testing manually it seems to work correctly. @tdraier do you think we can merge this PR?
I see that you have changed the pull request title, but you'll also need to change the commit message and preferably keep both UNOMI-151 and the description.

It works for me:
- by default Unomi responds 200 to MF
- when I forget sessionId parameter I get 400
- if I send invalid JSON in body, I get 400
- if I won't send body, I get 200, but I guess it's OK

Also thanks for chaning the commit message to indicate ticket number and rebasing.

All good to go for me!
Ok thanks for the tests I'll merge this now.
As discussed over the phone, I think it would be better to fix the problem on the updates of the cached structures inside the ProfileServiceImpl.

So this means that we cannot build the package without running the integration tests ? That seems like quite a limitation during development where we might be rebuilding the package to test some changes, but we don't necessarily want to run the integration tests at this point. 

Also I wonder if this isn't just putting a requirement that the itests must have run once previously, but not necessarily in this current build, and therefore old itests might have been ok but not the current ones ?

No, we can build a package without integration tests. If you don't specify -Pintegration-test profile, the tests won't run (checked). I also experimented with `optional` dependency, but in the end it wasn't necessary.

As for old tests, I don't know. When I run `mvn clean install` it runs them every time, I will try without clean.
Wow thanks Oliver for this I wasn't expecting it ! I will test and merge asap !

We won't merge this pull request as it changes the way aggregate works, there is no aggregation result so we do not return filtered data. instead you can use the /count end point to achieve what you want to do.

I created a new "manual" module including :

- the documentation merged in asciidoc format (`src/main/asciidoc`)
- the css for the html generation of the documentation (`src/main/asciidoc/apache.css`)
- the theme for the pdf generation of the documentation (`src/theme`)

The theme for the html and the pdf is based on the [ASF](https://apache.org) website.

The generation use the `asciidoctor-maven-plugin` for html and pdf.

To generate the html documentation, use the **html** maven profile :
```
> mvn -Phtml
```
The website is generated under `target/generated-html/${project.version}` and the main page is `index.html`

To generate the pdf documentation, use the **pdf** maven profile :
```
> mvn -Ppdf
```
The pdf is generated under the repository `target/generated-pdf/${project.version}` and the main document is `index.pdf`

NB: in order to archive the older versions of the existing documentation, I migrated them from markdown to asciidoc  under `${project.basedir}/src/site/archives`.

Problem fixed. I close this PR.

https://segment.com/docs/spec/identify/
"Our recommendation for when and how often you should call identify is as follows:

After a user registers
After a user logs in
When a user updates their info (eg changes or adds a new address)"


In this case, should I use
1. "(Preferred) Use you own custom event(s) to send data you want to be inserted in a profile, and use rules to map the event data to the profile." as given under section 3.2.3. HOW TO UPDATE A PROFILE FROM THE PUBLIC INTERNET (https://unomi.apache.org/manual/latest/index.html#_how_to_update_a_profile_from_the_public_internet)
or
2. "performs an server-to-server call to send the login event to Apache Unomi using the Unomi key." as given under section 3.2.8. HOW TO SEND A LOGIN EVENT TO UNOMI (https://unomi.apache.org/manual/latest/index.html#_how_to_send_a_login_event_to_unomi)

To comply with the integration implementation of analytics.js for Javascript client, I believe the option 1 (invoke call from Javascript) seems to be the way. 


Then, "Setup a rule that can check a profile property to see if profiles can be merged on an universal identifier such as an email address by calling analytics.identify([userId], [traits], [options], [callback]). The example of rule is similar to https://github.com/apache/unomi/blob/master/samples/login-integration/src/main/resources/META-INF/cxs/rules/exampleLogin.json
This rule calls an action called :
mergeProfilesOnPropertyAction
What this means is that upon successful login using an email, Unomi will look for other profiles that have the same email and merge them into a single profile." 


However, this doesn't seems to solve the security concern you have: "Normally an identify should be a secure operation because it can merge with other profile". How can we call identity from public internet and merge profile based on userId?
